result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah A. Conley

records.addlTxt: Writ of Habeas Corpus - BFH - 11-08-22; SDS - 11-08-22

Defendant Isaiah A. Conley not in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Isaiah A. Conley.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in Racine Co. Jail. State to prepare WRIT. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Invocation of Right to Counsel
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Timelines

BOND TO COVER ALL CASES 22CF463, 19CM816, 19CT633, 19CT641, 20CT222 & 21CM334

DEFENDANT MUST POST $250 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

2:57 PM (64-06) Defendant Isaiah A. Conley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Isaiah A. Conley.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Defense acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges.
Speedy is reserved.

Bond Motion Hearing held.
Argument by Attorney Renz.
ADA Crawford objects to modifying the Bond and gives argument.
Court will grant the modification to the Bond.

Cash amended down to $250.00 all other conditions remain.
Move BFH set for 10/11/22 at 8:30AM change to 10/10/22 at 1:15PM.

Adj. 3:00 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond
Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaiah A. Conley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Isaiah A. Conley.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing information and rights given. Hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Ashley Renz
Ashley Renz
Signed bond filed with the court.

Called at 1:40 PM. Defendant Isaiah A Conley in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ashley Renz for defendant. Court reads risk assessment in to the record. Defendant not eligible for pretrial services. Record by Attorney Berg as to bond. Response by Attorney Renz as to bond and trial dates set on pending matters. Court forfeits prior bond. All conditions from prior bond are to be added to the current and and made total bond. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice of Arrest
See signature bond for conditions

*8/23/22: BOND AMENDED TO COVER ALL CASES (22GF879, 19CM816, 19CT633, 19CT641, 20CT222 & 21CM334). PRIOR CONDITIONS ADDED: Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia*

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
